verses.verse: By the rivers <WH5104> of Babylon, <WH894> There <WH8033> we sat <WH3427> down <WH3427> and wept, <WH1058> When we remembered <WH2142> Zion. <WH6726>
Upon the willows <WH6155> in the midst <WH8432> of it We hung <WH8518> our harps. <WH3658>

For there <WH8033> our captors <WH7617> demanded <WH7592> of us songs, <WH1697> <WH7892> And our tormentors <WH8437> mirth, <WH8057> [saying], "Sing <WH7891> us one of the songs <WH7892> of Zion. <WH6726>"
How <WH349> can we sing <WH7891> the Lord's song <WH7892> In a foreign <WH5236> land <WH127>?
If <WH518> I forget <WH7911> you, O Jerusalem, <WH3389> May my right <WH3225> hand <WH3225> forget <WH7911> [her skill.]

May my tongue <WH3956> cleave <WH1692> to the roof <WH2441> of my mouth, <WH2441> If <WH518> I do not remember <WH2142> you, If <WH518> I do not exalt <WH5927> Jerusalem <WH3389> Above <WH5921> my chief <WH7218> joy. <WH8057>

Remember, <WH2142> O Lord, <WH3068> against the sons <WH1121> of Edom <WH9000> The day <WH3117> of Jerusalem, <WH3389> Who said, <WH559> "Raze <WH6168> it, raze <WH6168> it, To its very foundation. <WH3247>"

O daughter <WH1323> of Babylon, <WH894> you devastated <WH7703> one, How blessed <WH835> will be the one who <WH7945> repays <WH9608> you With the recompense <WH1576> with which <WH7945> you have repaid <WH1580> us.
How blessed <WH835> will be the one who <WH7945> seizes <WH270> and dashes <WH5310> your little <WH5768> ones <WH5768> Against <WH413> the rock. <WH5553>
